Begin Mini-Page 21013
The Team
Everyone should be so lucky to be part of a workplace that truly feels like a family.
The leadership team listed below has an average of 21 years of service to Gleneagles. It is apparent that these numbers don't happen accidentally - our team enjoys working with each other and serving our members, and the membership respects and appreciates all our team members for their commitment to our club. Gleneagles is a workplace where individual contributions are recognized and celebrated, but teamwork, fun and friendship are valued above all!
“When you work with people whom you like and you admire because they’re so good at what they do, it doesn’t feel like work. It’s like you’re playing.” -Stan Lee
End Mini-Page 21013
end one-column
Begin Mini-Page 21270
Leadership Team
Kraig has been the General Manager of Gleneagles Country Club since August of 2005. He is originally from West Palm Beach, Florida and graduated from Florida International University in Miami with a Bachelor’s degree in Hospitality Management. He has more than 30 years of private club experience in both national and international arenas. His background includes working as a General Manager at several Club Corp properties, Mayacoo Lakes Country Club in West Palm Beach, and the Boca Raton Resort and Club.
Kraig Spina
General Manager / COO
row
Harvey has been the Chief Financial Officer of Gleneagles Country Club since 1999. Originally from The Bronx, New York, Harvey attended Bernard M. Baruch College at The City University of New York and graduated with a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration in Accounting. In 2014, Harvey was recognized as a finalist for the South Florida Business Journal CFO of the Year. His background includes 13 years at St. Andrews Country Club in Boca Raton as their CFO.
Harvey Grunwald
Chief Financial Officer
row
Kristen joined the Gleneagles team in 2008 and was promoted to the Director of Membership & Marketing position in 2011. Originally from Boca Raton, Kristen graduated from the University of Central Florida with a Bachelor’s in Marketing and Master’s in Business Administration (MBA). Her professional background includes hospitality management and marketing positions at the Greater Boca Raton Chamber of Commerce, Grand Cypress Resort, and the University of Central Florida. Kristen is an avid community volunteer and is currently serving as Executive Vice President on the Board of Directors for the Junior League of the Palm Beaches.
Kristen Laraia
Clubhouse Manager / Director of Membership & Marketing
row
Regan Samaniego started his career at Gleneagles in 2004 and worked in a variety of positions of increasing responsibility in the Food and Beverage department. Regan is a graduate of Florida Atlantic University. Regan oversees the entire Food and Beverage operation, including the service team, culinary staff, menu development, purchasing operations, catering, and private events. Regan works very closely with Executive Chef, Chris Reichart in order to create best-in-class cuisine and service in the three restaurants and lounges at Gleneagles Country Club.
Regan Samaniego
Clubhouse Manager / Director of Food & Beverage
row
Jason joined the Gleneagles team in 2010 as the Director of Golf Course Maintenance. Jason came to us after a successful career at Westview Country Club in Miami. Jason hails from North Carolina, but he has had plenty of experience with southern turf. He earned a Bachelor’s in Turfgrass Science from the University of Florida, and served a term as President of the South Florida Golf Course Superintendent Association.
Jason Bagwell
Director of Golf Course Maintenance
row
A native of Colombia, David has lived in Florida since 1989 and joined Gleneagles in 1990. Since then, he has experienced and participated in the various transformations of the club, especially the facilities maintenance department. His commitment, dedication, and persistence have made him successful as a supervisor and facilities superintendent, and in May 2023, David was promoted to Director of Community Operations. To complement his continued personal and professional growth, David has achieved a Bachelor’s in Business Administration with summa cum laude honors and a MBA from Nova Southeastern University.
David Jaimes
Community Operations Director
row
End Mini-Page 21270

Begin Mini-Page 21288
Membership
Your Best Life Starts Here
Gleneagles is a private, mandatory membership, residential Country Club Community. Prospective members can select the type of membership that will best suit their lifestyle: Social, Golf, Tennis, and Full memberships are available.
All membership categories include the use of all club dining venues and lounges, fitness center and spa, main pool complex, card rooms and lounges, and seven satellite clubhouses each with their own pool and spa. With one of South Florida’s best golf and tennis programs, fine dining, and the friendliest neighbors and staff in town, we know that Gleneagles has what it takes to make your next house a home. Gleneagles Country Club is regarded as one of the best private, country club membership values in South Florida.
Initial country club new member capital contributions range from $95,000 to $125,000.
Contact the
Membership Office
for a full outline of country club dues and fees. Estoppel Requests can be made via email to our
CFO Harvey Grunwald
.
Become a Member
End Mini-Page 21288
end one-column
Begin Mini-Page 21289
Membership Tiers
End Mini-Page 21289
end one-column
Begin Photo Album 1365
End Photo Album 1365
Begin Mini-Page 21290
Full Membership
Full Membership provides the complete experience in the sporting and social lifestyle. Full Membership provides all of the Golf, Tennis, and Social Membership privileges. A perfect membership for golf, tennis and pickleball players, there is simply no better way to spend your days at Gleneagles Country Club.
Become a Member
End Mini-Page 21290
Begin Photo Album 1367
End Photo Album 1367
Begin Mini-Page 21291
Golf Membership
Golf Membership is our most popular membership category, and offers all of the Social Membership benefits in addition to full use of all golf facilities. Golf members have access to the 18-Hole Par 71 Victory Course and the 18-Hole Par 72 Legends Course; in addition to a spacious practice facility featuring a driving range, chipping area, and putting green. Golf members enjoy participating in weekly league tournaments, instruction from a staff of PGA Professionals, and a full schedule of social activities.
Become a Member
End Mini-Page 21291
Begin Photo Album 1369
End Photo Album 1369
Begin Mini-Page 21292
Tennis Membership
Tennis Membership provides all of the Social Membership benefits in addition to the full use of all tennis facilities, including 19 Har Tru Tennis Courts and 8 Pickleball Courts. Tennis members also enjoy complimentary use of a ball machine with the revolutionary PickupWall and an active tournament and social schedule, including team and league play throughout the county. Tennis Members have access to instruction from a staff of USPTA professionals, and there are plenty of complementary clinics available to tennis members throughout the year.
Become a Member
End Mini-Page 21292
Begin Photo Album 1371
End Photo Album 1371
Begin Mini-Page 21293
Social Membership
A Social Membership provides access to enjoy all social amenities and activities, including all restaurants and lounges, the Fitness Center, Pools and Satellite Clubhouses and the Men’s and Ladies’ Card Rooms.
Become a Member
End Mini-Page 21293
